    "an inflation of a cellular algebra is cellular again . in particular , an iterated inflation of @xmath258 copies of @xmath42",
    "is cellular , with a cell chain of length @xmath258 as in definition [ defn : kxcelluar ] .",
    "more precisely , the second statement has the following meaning .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we present an algebra related to the coxeter group of type @xmath0 which can be viewed as the brauer algebra of type @xmath0 and is obtained as a subalgebra of the brauer algebra of type @xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> we also describe some properties of this algebra .    </S>",
    "<S> when studying tensor decompositions for orthogonal groups , brauer ( @xcite ) introduce algebras which we now call brauer algebras of type @xmath2 . cohen , frenk and wales ( @xcite ) extended the definition to simply laced types , including type @xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> tits ( @xcite ) described how to obtain the coxeter group of type @xmath0 as the fixed subgroup of the coxeter group of type @xmath1 under a diagram automorphism ( also seen in @xcite ) . </S>",
    "<S> for this , mhlherr gave a more general way by admissible partitions to obtain coxeter groups as subgroups in coxeter groups in @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> here we will apply a similar method to the brauer algebra @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> this is a part of a project to define brauer algebras of spherical types ( @xcite , @xcite ) . </S>",
    "<S> it turns out that the presentation by generators and relations obtainable from the dynkin diagram of type @xmath0 in the same way as was done for type @xmath4 ( @xcite ) and @xmath5 ( @xcite ) . </S>",
    "<S> + first we give the definition of @xmath6 using a presentation . </S>",
    "<S> let @xmath7 be the generator of the infinite cyclic group .    </S>",
    "<S> [ 0.1 ] the brauer algebra of type @xmath0 , denoted by @xmath6 , is a unital associative @xmath8$]-algebra generated by @xmath9 , subject to the following relations . @xmath10 and for @xmath11 , @xmath12 here @xmath13 means that @xmath14 and @xmath15 are connected by a simple bond and @xmath16 means that there is no bond ( simple or multiple ) between @xmath14 and @xmath15 in the dynkin diagram of type @xmath0 depicted in the figure [ e6f4d ] . </S>",
    "<S> the submonoid of the multiplicative monoid of @xmath6 generated by @xmath7 , @xmath17 is denoted by @xmath18 . </S>",
    "<S> this is the monoid of monomials in @xmath6 .    </S>",
    "<S> the defining relations ( [ 0.1.13])([0.1.20 ] ) can be found in @xmath19 in @xcite and @xmath20 in @xcite by renumbering indices . </S>",
    "<S> note that these relations are not symmetric for @xmath21 and @xmath22 . </S>",
    "<S> their relations are fully determined by the dynkin diagram in the sense that all relations depend only on the vertices and bonds of the dynkin diagram and the lengths of their roots . </S>",
    "<S> + it is well known that the coxeter group @xmath23 of type @xmath0 , can be obtained as the subgroup from the coxeter group @xmath24 of type @xmath1 , of elements invariant under the automorphism of @xmath24 determined by the diagram automorphism @xmath25 indicated as a permutation on the generators of @xmath24 whose dynkin diagram are labeled and presented in figure [ e6f4d ] .     and @xmath0 ]    </S>",
    "<S> the action @xmath27 can be extended to an automorphism of the brauer algebra of type @xmath1 by acting on the temperley - lieb generators @xmath28 ( @xcite ) by the same permutation as for weyl group generators . </S>",
    "<S> we denote by @xmath29 the subalgebra generated by @xmath27-invariant elements in @xmath30 . </S>",
    "<S> the main theorem of this paper is the following . in order to avoid confusion with the above generators , </S>",
    "<S> the generators of @xmath3 have been capitalized .    </S>",
    "<S> [ mainthm ] there is an algebra isomorphism @xmath31 determined by @xmath32 , @xmath33 , @xmath34 , @xmath35 , and @xmath36 , @xmath37 , @xmath38 , @xmath39 . </S>",
    "<S> furthermore , the algebra @xmath6 is free over @xmath8 $ ] of rank @xmath40 .    </S>",
    "<S> the proof of the theorem is finished in section [ sect : image ] . moreover , in the last section we will prove that the algebra @xmath41 for a field @xmath42 is cellularly stratified . </S>",
    "<S> this paper is included as chapter @xmath43 in the author s phd thesis ( @xcite ) . </S>"
  ]
}
